page.title: 03THE THURSDAY MARKET
page.content: ON 2nd MAY MR DE MASSEY TOOK A GROUP OF CHILDREN TO THE THURSDAY MARKET TO INTERVIEW SOME STALLHOLDERS.SOME OF THEM WERE HAPPY TO ANSWER OUR QUESTIONS.THEIR REPLIES WERE:THEY SOLD DIFFERENT THINGS-SWEETS,CLOTHES, {GROCERY,ELECTRICAL GOODS,FISH,MEAT, {CHEESE,}ETC.SOME OF THEM HAVE TRAVELLED UP TO{60/70}MILES,FROM{ {KETTERING,MILTON KEYNES,GRIMSBY, {COLCHESTER}AND SOME CAME FROM THE LOCAL NEIGHBOURHOOD.THEY ALL SEEM TO MAKE A LIVING.THEY HAVE SMALL FAMILIES AND ENJOY THEIR WORK.WE ALSO VISITED THE SITE OF THE AGRICULTURAL MACHINERY SALES BUT WERE NOT ALLOWED TO WALK ROUND FOR SAFTEY REASONS.MICHAEL EDWARDS,SARAH DOWNHAM,TRACY PARTRIDGE, ANNE MILLAR,SARAH NIGHTINGALE,JOANNE CORCORAN,NINA,SHARON,VICKY AND LORNA CAME TO THE THURSDAY MARKET.
